intro: Trichosanthes tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly gourd or hairy pumpkin, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and melons. The plant produces large, lobed leaves and yellow flowers that give way to elongated, spiny fruits. Its fruit is typically harvested when immature and used in various culinary preparations. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
